channel.title: Wifi speed regulation
channel.description: Is there a way i can slow the wifi speed at a certain mac adress

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:554480”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=673404.msg4502961#msg4502961 date=1453408354]
my router is UBEE
[/quote]

If you want to do QoS, get a proper router. I do not own one myself but I know a lot of people who shower the ASUS RT-AC68U with praise - check it out.[/quote]Can confirm, have same router. Never had any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Jmood:

PS4 and computer would get the highest bandwidth allocation while my sisters boyfriends computer would get the lowest.

That is quality!!

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The ASUS 87R is a very good router. I set up the manual QoS and set in the rules that my PS4 and computer would get the highest bandwidth allocation while my sisters boyfriends computer would get the lowest. You can set minimum reserved bandwidth and also max usage. so I set it so they get 10 mb/s max because they like to torrent things.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Wouldn’t get your hopes up if you bought your router from the cheap end of town. I think a lot of manufacturers hold out on the QoS configuration until you’re beyond the $150 price point.

You could look into the free software firmware offering though and investigate whether one of them supports your router: http://securerouter.org/tech-tips/dd-wrt-or-tomato-or-openwrt-or/

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Thanks for the suggestions i’ll look into it if i come into something i’ll tell you

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

You could install some open-source firmware to your router that may give you the option. I’m not too sure if it’s a hardware limitation though.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Strucker:

my router is UBEE

If you want to do QoS, get a proper router. I do not own one myself but I know a lot of people who shower the ASUS RT-AC68U with praise - check it out.

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:4, topic:554480”]It’s hard to say. You could download some software that can add a cap.
The alternative is to hope your router supports QoS which handles devices by priority (sounds like a good solution to your problem) or a throttel control.[/quote]I’ve been looking for the QoS section even before i started this thread but i can’t seem to find it, my router is UBEE I’ll let know if i figure out something, thanks though

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi speed regulation
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

It’s hard to say. You could download some software that can add a cap.
The alternative is to hope your router supports QoS which handles devices by priority (sounds like a good solution to your problem) or a throttel control.

Read full topic
